headline.main: It's Only May, and the Tanorexics Are Already Complaining

docs.abstract: Editorial Observer by Carol E Lee on tanned skin as fashion statement; describes those who keep pursuing tan--by excessive sunbathing or frequent visits to tanning salon--as tanorexic (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: A friend of mine stopped by my apartment on the night she returned from a recent five-day vacation in the Dominican Republic. Her olive skin had tanned to a deep golden brown. But, she exclaimed, could I believe it? Her tan had faded on the four-hour airplane ride back to New York, and she needed to visit a tanning salon to get it back! I could not believe it.
docs.snippet: There's something new (and bronze) under the sun.
